title: Timsbury Walks

images.title: Maurice Pullin, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Radford Hill Timsbury. Dropping to Radford, just over half a mile away at the bottom of the valley. Part of Peasedown St.John can be seen at the top of the ridge on the other side.

images.title: Donnylad / Signs of spring
images.caption: Signs of spring. View toward the former rail line with Timsbury Bottom forming the backdrop

images.title: Radford Mill by Rose and Trev Clough, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons

images.title: Roger Cornfoot / Bungay's Hill, High Littleton
images.caption: Bungay's Hill, High Littleton

images.title: Maurice Pullin / Near Timsbury
images.caption: Looking over North Somerset farmland near Timsbury. Wallmead House Farm is about 50 yards behind the camera. There are the remains of an ancient hill fort on the hill in front.

images.title: Maurice Pullin, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: A look into Timsbury Bottom. Timsbury Bottom Farm is down the hill with High Littleton peering over the next ridge. The area is riddled with old mine workings.

images.title: Maurice Pullin, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: At the top of Bungay's Hill. On the minor road between Timsbury and High Littleton.

description: This Somerset based village is surrounded by some attractive rolling countryside and woodland. There's also numerous fine walking options in the nearby Mendip Hills. This circular walk from the village visits Greyfield Woods, High Littleton and Bungay's Hill. The walk starts in the village and follows Mill Lane south towards Radford. Here you can pick up the Limestone Link and follow the trail west along the Cam Brook towards Hallatrow, passing Paulton on the way. The walk then turns north to visit Greyfield Woods. These woods have some nice peaceful trails with ancient woodland, spring bluebells and a pretty waterfall to see. From the woods you head east through High Littleton before following a country lane along Bungay's Hill to return you to Timsbury. There's some nice views over the surrounding countryside from this final elevated section of the walk.
